Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to declare dependent under Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the immigration officer's rejection of the humanitarian and compassionate grounds application was reasonable
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Inland exemption application on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Remitted for reconsideration by a different officer
Evidence_Ignored: Time constraints due to visa restrictions
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Misapprehension of evidence regarding education and establishment
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient evidence of hardship and inadequate establishment in Canada
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Misinterpretation of applicant’s university acceptance and financial feasibility
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Deficient reasoning and failure to consider all factors globally

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of the immigration officer's rejection of the H&C application
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant not declared as dependent; applied for inland exemption in 2010 after visiting Canada
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Rejection of humanitarian and compassionate application
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Judicial review granted due to unreasonable decision
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Misapprehension of evidence and inadequate justification
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Errors in assessing education, establishment, and hardship
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Need for global consideration of H&C factors
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Underestimated hardships and misinterpreted educational prospects
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Section on H&C considerations in IRPA
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Speculation without supporting analysis on university admission
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Risk of separation from family and limited opportunities abroad
Crimes.Cause_Description: Father failed to declare applicant during immigration in 1995
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Duty to fairly assess H&C factors
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Failure to properly interpret educational intent and financial barriers
Crimes.Residency_Compliance: Applicant had temporary status but limited time to establish
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Insufficient demonstration of hardship and establishment
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of reasoned justification for conclusions

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of immigration officer’s assessment of education and establishment
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Officer misapprehended evidence on education and integration
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate compelling H&C grounds
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Humanitarian and compassionate applications must be assessed globally
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable evaluation of establishment and education
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Deficient due to misinterpretation of evidence
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Unreasonable decision despite strong establishment indicators
Crimes.Court_Result: Remanded for reconsideration by different officer
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Maintained original refusal based on perceived lack of establishment
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 71(1)
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Exclusion due to non-declaration as dependent

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Correct legal test for humanitarian and compassionate assessment
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Misinterpretation of applicant's educational intentions and establishment efforts
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to show exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Legal_Rule: H&C factors must be considered globally, best interests of child paramount
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Failure to adequately justify decision or consider all relevant factors
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Misinterpretation of evidence and inadequate reasoning
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Officer speculated about university acceptance without considering financial reality
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 71(1)
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Original decision upheld due to perceived lack of integration
Crimes.Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to be included in family class sponsorship
Crimes.Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application for permanent residence on H&C grounds
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Requirement for global and fair assessment of H&C factors
